"How long was that on there?" He asked wiping his nose with his blanket.

She only smiled. "Two hours." Carla said while leaving the room. Jamie sighed and changed into his normal clothes. He walked out of his shared room and walked downstairs, seeing his sister Wendy in her gym clothes, her feet resting on the coffee table, her gym socks not too far from the table.

"Well good morning sleepy head, I guess Carla woke you." Wendy said, stifling a giggle. She laughed at the expense of your sense of smell.

"Yeah," he answered simply. Wiping his nose in disgust at the recent memory.

"At least your dressed Cathy will be here any minute."

"Right, where is Mary?"

"She's outside on the swing set." Wendy said, pointing her can of soda outside. Jamie nodded and walked outside, and sure enough his sister was swinging on an old swing that was probably older than his parents. He made his way around the pool, and passed the garden. Mary waved to her brother and planted her feet firmly on the dirt, nearly stumbling on the ground. Jamie chuckled to himself as he helped his sister regain her balance. He couldn't help but notice that his sister kicked an anthill without knowing, he also noticed an ant climb around her sock, only to be crushed by her other foot that scratched her leg. Jamie felt a chill down his spine as he watched the ant die.

"So how's everything?" Mary asked, Jamie just shrugged. Mary's connection with Jamie was able to tell her he was feeling odd.

"I can't help but feel something is off." James said quietly, Mary thought nothing of it and figured it was best to ignore it.

"Hey Cathy's here!" They heard Carla yell out the back window, both twins ran up to the back door. They both scrambled to the front both eager to see Catherine.

"Sorry I'm late, there was an accident in the highway and traffic was ins-"

"Cathy!" Mary screamed while diving towards the taller blonde. Catherine smiled and did her best to hold up the ten year old.

"Hey there short stuff." Catherine greeted happily, letting down the girl from her grip.

"Hi Catherine." Jamie greeted her almost formally, he was self conscious on the way she taunted them for being the youngest.

"And there's the smallest," she rubbed in. Wendy crouched down, but she managed to be slightly taller than him. Jamie groaned as she patted his head with a look of adoration.

Several Hours Later...

Jamie clutched his chest in pain, feeling something strange wash over him. He sat up in bed, stifling a scream so he drank the water he had on his bedside table.

"Jamie?" Mary asked, she sat up next to him. Her chest burning with just as much pain.

"Yes, Mary?" he asked.

"My stomach hurts..." Mary whined, reaching for her own glass of water.

"Mine does too." Jamie added, he felt the pain slowly go away.

Jamie woke up to the sound of thundering footsteps, he jolted upwards and looked up to the ceiling. Jamie noticed that the ceiling was farther then usual, he stood up and saw that the landscape went on for miles. He rubbed his eyes in disbelief and hoped to himself that it was just a dream.

"What the?" Jamie stood up and was thankful that his pajamas shrunk with him, even though he figured that his pajamas would provide little protection from the cold. He compared himself the the pillow and figured he was about half an inch tall. Panicked, the shrunken boy ran in the direction that his sister might have been in.

"Mary! Mary, where are you?" James shouted out loud, hoping that his sister was safe. He ran along the massive pillow, running faster than he was used to. Once he reached the end of his pillow...

"Are you serious?"

"Haha, be careful, Carla!" Mary called out, helping a slightly more dizzy Jamie to stand up, but still giggling.

"Where is everyone?" Catherine said, walking over to the tupperware bin of pancakes that were beginning to cool. She hadn't eaten since lunch yesterday, and was starving. If it wasn't obvious by the way she eyed the food, then the way her stomach growled nice and loud made it abundantly clear that she was ready for breakfast.

"The twins are with Carla, getting cleaned up for breakfast. Have a seat!" Wendy hadnt noticed Carla putting the twins on the plate. Hoping to surprise her older sister with her shrunken sibs, Wendy failed to mention their new, tiny stature. Had she known that Catherine was so close to them, she might have mentioned it. How many pancakes do you want?"

"Ohh..how about three? No...four! I'm starving..." Catherine was practically drooling with the smell of the fresh pancakes wafting into her nose, filling her lungs. Giggling, Wendy carried the tupperware with pancakes inside over to the table, and grabbed four pancakes with tongs.

After a moment, listening to their sisters' conversation, they stopped and decided to wait until Catherine was looking closer in their direction. Unfortunately, things were not looking good for the tiny twins. Initially, buried under the pancake, they clung to each other out of fear. Now, being lifted away from the plate and into the air, the only thing holding them was the syrup. It prevented them from plummeting back down to the cold, hard table, but was also preventing them from avoiding a very dark, painful death in their sister's mouth, or worse, stomach. As the fork holding the pancake they were stuck to moved closer to Catherine's mouth, the realized something.

"Oh no, no no...Jamie! You're...youre slipping!" Mary gasped, watching Jamie, who had previously been at eye-level with her, now slowly fell to waist height.

"Quick, grab me!" Jamie said, reaching to grab his sister's leg

"No, don't grab me! This could be your chance to get away!" She cried, tears beginning to stream down her face. "Save yourself, Jamie!"

"I'm not going anywhere with you!" As he replied, he realized that they'd been hovering in the air for nearly thirty seconds now, more than enough time for them to have been eaten already. Turning his syrup-covered head, Jamie looked out towards Catherine, whose lips were only a fork's length away. 'Why hasn't she eaten us yet? He wondered, before finally seeing the reason, she was still chewing the last bite! Catherine's soft, pouty lips scrunched and stretched and contorted in and out of shape quickly, as her jaw lowered and raised to chew the previous victim of her appetite. It was surreal, they'd seen Catherine eat dozens of meals, hundreds even. She came home every weekend from college, every break and holiday, and even randomly during the week. But never before had Mary and Jamie gotten such a look at the process of her chewing. They could even hear the sound of the pancake mush being mulled around and chewed into a thick, sticky bolus for the gigantic blonde to swallow.

And then it happened, the fork moved away, just barely, from those huge lips. Had they been saved?

"Cath', here's some OJ! Don't choke on those pancakes, the way you're going through them, they must be good!" Wendy giggled, setting the orange juice down next to Catherine's plate. In response, Catherine swallowed her mouthful, and held back a chuckle.

"Haha, yeah...they're amazing, Wendy!" Wendy blushed some, setting her coffee down on the table next to the glass of juice, to do a little curtsey in thanks.

"Well, let me get you a few more!" Stepping back over to the plastic container holding the warm pancakes, the sixteen year old beamed at getting her sister's approval, without some sort of mean-spirited joke behind it. At least not yet. "Just save some for Carla and the twins...you know how grumpy Mary gets without breakfast." Mary, at the moment, was decidedly finished eating breakfast.

Meanwhile, the shrunken twins on Catherine's pancake were not sure if they were overjoyed or washed with fear. After hearing that thick mouthful of pancake that used to be the sky of their world plummet down their sister's throat, they knew that going there behind it would mean death. Even worse, Catherine's mouth opened, and poured a syrupy sweet torrent of warm breath over them. Even slightly farther away from the mouth than they were a moment ago, the mouth was entirely too large to behold, and now they were watching it in action, while Catherine talked.

Not only did they have that to deal with, but that binding syrup has lost some of it's sticky integrity, and now both twins were sliding down the flat surface of the pancake. Still hovering in front of Catherine's lips, they knew that they only had precious seconds before they fell off of the pancake, or were delivered in the deep, dark, humid cave of their sister's mouth.

12132.content:
With an entertained giggle, Wendy quickly noticed the two tiny children, both of which waving their arms frantically. "Whoops, didn't see you there," she said with a small smile. Catherine, both confused and a little freaked out, tried to figure out what her younger sister was looking at.
"Uh, Wendy, Who are you talking to?" Catherine asked. Realizing how crazy she might have looked, Wendy glanced at her sister.

"How do I say this?" Wendy quickly asked herself. She found it hard putting it into the correct words while making sense. Then again, nothing about the situation seemed to make any sense; she held her youngest siblings in her her hands and still had no idea on how to explain it. With a long sigh, Wendy simply said, "see for yourself."

Wendy swiftly scooped up Mary and Jamie in her pale, fleshy hand and brought it to her blonde sister. The shrunken twins lost their balance and rolled over each other, bumping their heads together with each shake. When they recovered, they were greeted by a large pair of blue eyes that belonged to their oldest sister, Catherine.

"Uh, hello, Cathy," said Jamie nonchalantly, waving his arm slowly. Mary added her own greeting in a much more enthusiastic tone.

"H-hi..." Catherine trailed off, her eyes wide open. She waved a finger at them. "Wha- I don't even... What?" Catherine brought her index finger up to the children, poking them softly; Mary let herself tumble over with a giggle while Jamie fought back with his little strength. "What happened to you two?"

Her question was answered with a simple shrug of the shoulders from Jamie. "We just woke up like this, Cathy." Mary's answer was just as ambiguous, leaving Catherine a little annoyed. Catherine kept her mouth wide open in shock, giving them an unsettling view of her open mouth. Small strands of saliva hung from the roof of the mouth, and giant white boulders of teeth jutted from the pink ceiling; the sight scared the twins, and they backed away in response.

Catherine caught the twins' discomfort and brought a hand up to her mouth to hide the massive cave, and they finally began to approach their sister.

Wendy, noticing the pancakes almost burning, unceremoniously dumped her siblings into Catherine's palm, and the the twins found themselves plummeting towards the ground. Fortunately, Catherine reacted quickly and caught the two, preventing an accidental death. Instead of air resistance, Mary and Jamie suddenly felt another soft surface, accompanied by a soft, strawberry scent. Another audible laugh came from above; it wasn't mocking or even playful. Her voice seemed coddling, like someone would treat a baby or a small animal.

"You two are so cute like this. I could just eat you two up," she cooed while making an exaggerated kissing motion. Moving her palm and the tiny twins closer to her massive mouth and puckered her lips. Catherine's obvious poor choice of words had caused the twins (mostly Jamie) to beg for her to stop. Catherine tilted her hand at a steep incline, and the twins began to fall towards their sister's large lips.

Bouncing slightly, Mary and Jamie found it hard to stand up; their attempts to stand up ruined by the slight tremors caused y the small, unnoticeable movements of their sister. And seconds later, a fleshy pink snake slid out of the two soft pieces of skin. Jamie, being the unlucky twin, was swept up by the viscous saliva, prompting the boy to scream in surprise. Mary watched from the upper lip with the same look of shock. Extending her hand, Mary tried to grab her brother and pull him to safety.

"Jamie!" Mary screamed, " grab my hand!" Upon hearing the instruction, Jamie reached out for his sister's waiting hand. He waved his hand blindly, sapping his strength and motivation by the second. He let out a sigh of relief as he felt Mary's hand make contact with his, and both siblings gripped tightly, nearly hurting each other's hands.

There small victory was short lived as a huge gust of wind followed by a tidal wave's worth of spit hit them. They kept their tight grip, though. To their giant sister Catherine, it didn't seem like she put them through much harm. It was a simple breath and an unnoticeable amount of spit to her, but to the shrunken kids, a hurricane and tsunami.

"Eww, gross." Jamie complained while wiping away his older sister's saliva.

"Now we smell like your breath!" yelled Mary. She twisted her locks of brown hair, trying to remove all traces of her oldest sister's spit.

"See what you have done, Cath. Now they smell like pizza and potato chips." Wendy teased, pointing out Catherine's unhealthy eating habits.

"Actually not a bad thing to smell like, in my opinion." Catherine joked.

"Cathy, you're home!" Carla beamed, entering the room with a smile.

"Hey, Carls." Catherine greeted, adding a nickname that never failed to annoy Carla.

"Cat," Carla replied bitterly. Her counter was ineffective at being insulting and only served to make Catherine's joke more annoying, and Catherine found that completely adorable.

"Love ya too." Catherine teased, "how's the food going?" The conversation quickly shifted from playful jokes to food. Wendy simply dumped a small pile of pancakes on Catherine's plate.

"Eat," Wendy answered plainly. The red head made her way around the table, dropping the breakfast foods on her siblings plate. With the final two, Wendy placed both on her plate.

"Mary, Jamie? Where are you?"

"Down here!" their voices rang. Wendy glanced downwards and saw the twins pinned by the pancakes.

"Whoops." Wendy said with a chuckle, lifting up the pancake from the twins.

1232111.title: A Daring Escape

12321111.content:
"We need to act fast if we're going to save your sister," Sarah declared, standing up and adjusting her glasses. "Let's get to the bathroom."
"We can save her?" Jaime asked. "How?"
"We can pull her back up with a string. The only problem is she might not know what to do."

The trio made it into the single-person women's bathroom. Sarah locked the door and had Wendy sit down on the toilet. She then picked up Jaime and tied the string tightly around his waist while explaining what he should do.
"When you're in there, it's going to be loud, dark, and probably smelly. You're also gonna get knocked down a lot because her stomach's gonna try to digest those fries Wendy ate earlier. But there shouldn't be that much in there, so feel around and call out your sister's name to find her."
"What if she's... not all there," Wendy said regrettably, remembering all the crunching she had done.
"It's unlikely she was chewed. She was too small for your tongue to detect her and push her towards the teeth." Sarah finished tying the makeshift harness and sat Wendy down to prepare for the decent. "Oh, and Jaime. If you start to feel itchy or burny that's just... a food allergy. Ignore it, and you'll be fine, okay?"
"Okay," Jaime replied nervously. He feared for a lot of things, and that was just one more thing to fear.
"You have ten minutes, okay? I won't pull you out any sooner or later, so once you find her hug her tight and don't let go." Jaime nodded, ready to save his sister.
A tug was felt around his waist as Sarah hoisted him up to put him into Wendy's mouth. As he hung over her freckled face, he saw the tears in the corners of Wendy's eyes.

You there. Yes, you, dear reader. This isn't a madhouse, so there will be rules to how this story turns out.

Rules:


1: A somewhat decent understanding of grammar is preferred.
2: One sentence chapters will be deleted after three days if there are no further acceptable additions.
3: A character purposefully killing a tiny is not allowed, but accidentally is acceptable.
4: Probably don't need to say it but no incest or sexual content please.
5: Feel free to add characters. (Friends, extended family, etc...)
6: Perspective shifts are okay as long as you make it obvious.
7: Enjoy yourselves and feel free to add chapters.

Also, please make this include some sort of family bonding/hijinks. And by bonding, I don't necessarily mean taping a tiny person to another's foot. Try to write it like a normal, (or abnormal) family going through this situation. There are many stories on this site that have family members practically murder or torture their own kin for absolutely no reason other than, "You're tiny, and I have always hated you. Now I'm gonna kill you."

Characters:


James "Jamie" A ten year old boy with messy brown hair and brown eyes. He's smart for his age and likes to think of himself as the mature twin, even though he's eleven minutes younger than his twin sister.

Mary, (Twin sister) Jamie's slightly older, yet much less mature sister. She's silly and optimistic no matter what happens. She has the same shade of brown brown hair and eyes as Jamie. She'll probably think of shrinking as a fun situation with many opportunities for fun.

Catherine, the oldest sister, she's twenty one years old, and she is the one that is most likely going to play with the two of them for her own entertainment. Her parents wanted her to care for them because their mom doesn't trust her other sisters. She's blonde haired with blue eyes and a decent figure. She's incredibly bossy but not in a way that makes anyone dislike her. She's currently on break from college and she spends as much time home as she can.

Wendy, the twins' eighteen year old sister, with strawberry-blonde/red hair and green eyes. She's gentle and treats them the nicest out of the three, but her somewhat playful instincts take over while seeing the two of them the size of dolls. She's laid back and lazy but will always be there for her family, even if they're half an inch tall. She's not that athletic, but she often goes to the gym if her friends force her through the power of peer pressure. She's usually away from home at the local bookstore as her part time job.

Carla, she's fifteen and looks up to her oldest sister, looking like a younger version of Catherine. She's extremely mischievous and slightly mean spirited, but she's a bit too clumsy for anyone to take serious. She's rough with the twins because they're the only ones she's really older than. And she might be oblivious to accidentally causing them pain. She's part of a ballet school in her free time, and she'll often tease Jamie and Mary with her smelly ballet slippers.
